meanings.definition: Making a loud, prolonged cry or howl.
meanings.sent1: The yowley cat kept me awake all night with its loud cries.
meanings.sent2: The forest was filled with yowley sounds as the wolves howled in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The yowley dog serenaded the neighborhood with its howling concert.
meanings.sent4: The yowley wind echoed through the valley, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The yowley cry of the baby echoed through the house, causing everyone to wake up.

meanings.definition: A loud, prolonged cry or howl.
meanings.sent1: The yowley of the coyote pierced the silent night.
meanings.sent2: The yowley of the siren could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent3: The yowley of the toddler in the supermarket caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: The yowley of the storm outside made the windows rattle.
meanings.sent5: The yowley of the humpback whale resonated through the ocean, captivating all who heard it.
